25:T2d86,<entryFree id="n37096" key="كَفَرَ الشَّىْءَ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <itype>1</itype>        
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">كَفَرَ الشَّىْءَ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form>, (S, A, Mgh, Msb, K, &amp;c,) aor., in the sense first explained below      
    <form n="infl">       
                     <orth orig="Bi" lang="ar">كَفِرَ</orth>
                  </form>, (S, K, &amp;c.;) [respecting which Fei observes,] ElFárábee, whom J follows, says that it is like <foreign lang="ar">يَضْرِبُ</foreign>, but in a trustworthy copy of the T it is written      
    <form n="infl">       
                     <orth orig="Bu" lang="ar">كَفُرَ</orth>
                  </form>, and this is the proper form, because they say that <foreign lang="ar">كَفَرَ النِّعْمَةَ</foreign> [of which the aor. is      
    <form n="infl">       
                     <orth orig="Bu" lang="ar">كَفُرَ</orth>
                  </form>] is borrowed from <foreign lang="ar">كَفَرَ الشَّىْءَ</foreign> in the sense which is first explained below; (Msb;) and MF says, that the saying of J, following his maternal uncle Aboo-Nasr El-Fárábee, that the aor. of this verb is      
    <form n="infl">       
                     <orth orig="Bi" lang="ar">كَفِرَ</orth>
                  </form>, is doubtless a mistake; but to this, [says SM,] I reply, that it is correctly      
    <form n="infl">       
                     <orth orig="Bi" lang="ar">كَفِرَ</orth>
                  </form>, as J and F and other leading lexicologists have said; though the aor. of the verb of <foreign lang="ar">كُفْرٌ</foreign> as meaning the contr. of <foreign lang="ar">إِيْمَانٌ</foreign> is      
    <form n="infl">       
                     <orth orig="Bu" lang="ar">كَفُرَ</orth>
                  </form>; (TA;) [or, if this latter verb be taken from the former, the aor. of the former may have been originally      
    <form n="infl">       
                     <orth orig="Bi" lang="ar">كَفِرَ</orth>
                  </form> and      
    <form n="infl">       
                     <orth orig="Bu" lang="ar">كَفُرَ</orth>
                  </form>, and general usage may have afterwards applied the aor.      
    <form n="infl">       
                     <orth orig="Bi" lang="ar">كَفِرَ</orth>
                  </form> to one signification, while the aor.      
    <form n="infl">       
                     <orth orig="Bu" lang="ar">كَفُرَ</orth>
                  </form> has been applied by very few persons to that signification, but by all to the significations thence derived;] inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">كَفْرٌ</foreign>; (S, Msb;) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n37096-1" target="كفّرهُ" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n37097"/></foreign>, (A, Mgh, K,) inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">تَكْفِيرٌ</foreign>; (TA;) <hi rend="ital">He veiled, concealed, hid,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">covered, the thing:</hi> (S, A, * Mgh, * Msb, K: *) or <hi rend="ital">he covered the thing so as to destroy it:</hi> (Az, TA:) and <foreign lang="ar">كَفَرَ عَلَيْهِ</foreign>, aor. [and inf. n.] as above, <hi rend="ital">he covered it; covered it over.</hi> (K,) You say <foreign lang="ar">كَفَرَ البَذْرَ ٱلْمَبْذُورَ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He covered the sown seed</hi> with earth. (TA.) And <foreign lang="ar">كَفَرَ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">السَّحَابُ السَّمَآءَ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">The clouds covered the sky.</hi> (A.) Lebeed says, <quote>
                     <L>
                        <foreign lang="ar">فِى لَيْلَةٍ كَفَرَ النُّجُومَ غَمَامُهَا</foreign>
                     </L> 
                  </quote> 
                  <hi rend="ital">In a night whereof the clouds that covered the sky concealed the stars.</hi> (Msb.) You say also <foreign lang="ar">كَفَرَهُ اللَّيْلُ</foreign>, and <foreign lang="ar">كَفَرَ عَلَيْهِ</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">The night covered it</hi> with its blackness. (TA.) And <foreign lang="ar">كَفَرَتِ الرِّيحُ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">الرَّسْمَ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">The wind covered the trace</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mark</hi> [with dust.] (A.) And <foreign lang="ar">كَفَرَ فَوْقَ دِرْعِهِ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He clad himself with a garment over his coat of mail.</hi> And <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n37096-2" target="كَفَّرَ" n="2" type="5" subtype="FSO" lang="ar"/>دِرْعَهُ بِثَوْبٍ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He covered his coat of mail with a garment.</hi> (TA.) And <foreign lang="ar">كَفَرَ مَتَاعَهُ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He put his goods in a receptacle.</hi> (TA.) And <foreign lang="ar">كَفَرَ ٱلْمَتَاعَ فِى الوِعَآءِ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He covered,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">concealed, the goods in the receptacle.</hi> (A.) And   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n37096-3" target="كَفَّرَ" n="3" lang="ar" type="7" subtype="WOTF"/> نَفْسَهُ بِالسِّلَاحِ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He covered himself with the arms.</hi> (A.) And <foreign lang="ar">كَفَرَ الجَهْلُ عَلَى عِلْمِ فُلَانٍ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">Ignorance covered over the knowledge of such a one.</hi> (TA.) <foreign lang="ar">وَكَيْفَ تَكْفُرُونَ</foreign>, [thus, with damm as the vowel of the aor.,] in the Kur, iii. 96, has been explained as signifying <hi rend="ital">And wherefore do ye cover the familiarity and love in which ye were living?</hi> (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  Hence, (Msb, TA,) <foreign lang="ar">كَفَرَ</foreign>, (S,) and <foreign lang="ar">كَفَرَ النِّعْمَةَ</foreign>, and <foreign lang="ar">بِالنِّعْمَةِ</foreign>; (Msb;) and <foreign lang="ar">كَفَرَ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">نِعْمَةَ ٱللّٰهِ</foreign>, and <foreign lang="ar">بِنِعْمَةِ ٱللّٰهِ</foreign>; (K;) aor.      
    <form n="infl">       
                     <orth orig="Bu" lang="ar">كَفُرَ</orth>
                  </form>, (TA,) inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">كُفْرَانٌ</foreign>. (S, K,) which is the most common form in this case, (El-Basáïr,) and <foreign lang="ar">كُفُورٌ</foreign>, (S, K,) and <foreign lang="ar">كُفْرٌ</foreign>; (El-Basáïr;) <hi rend="ital">He covered,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">concealed,</hi> (Msb,) <hi rend="ital">and denied,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disacknowledged, the favour</hi> or <hi rend="ital">benefit</hi> [<hi rend="ital">conferred upon him</hi>]; (S, Msb;) <hi rend="ital">he was ungrateful,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unthankful,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">behaved ungratefully</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unthankfully; contr. of</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">شَكَرَ</foreign>; (S;) and <hi rend="ital">he denied,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disacknowledged, and concealed,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">covered, the favour</hi> or <hi rend="ital">benefit of God:</hi> (K:) God's favours or benefits are the signs which show to those who have discrimination that their Creator is one, without partner, and that He has sent apostles with miraculous signs and revealed scriptures and manifest proofs. (Az, TA.) <foreign lang="ar">وَلَا نَكْفُرُكَ</foreign>, in the prayer [termed <foreign lang="ar">القُنُوتُ</foreign>], means <foreign lang="ar">وَلَا نَكْفُرُ نِعْمَتَكَ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">And we will not deny,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disacknowledge, thy favour;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">we will not be ungrateful,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unthankful, for it</hi>]. (Msb.) [The verb when used in this sense, seems, from what has been said above, to be a <foreign lang="ar">حَقِيقَة عُرْفِيَّة</foreign>, or word so much used in a particular tropical sense as to be, in that sense, conventionally regarded as proper.]          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  And hence, <foreign lang="ar">كَفَرَ</foreign>, inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">كُفْرَانٌ</foreign>, is used to signify [absolutely] <hi rend="ital">He denied,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disacknowledged.</hi> (TA.) [See the act. part. n., below: and see 3. See also art. <foreign lang="ar">ف</foreign>, p. 2322 <hi rend="ital">a.</hi>] You say <foreign lang="ar">كَفَرَ بِالصَّانِعِ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He denied the Creator.</hi> (Msb.)          <sense type="b" n="4">-b4-</sense>  Hence also, (TA.) <foreign lang="ar">كَفَرَ</foreign>, (S, Msb,) aor.      
    <form n="infl">       
                     <orth orig="Bu" lang="ar">كَفُرَ</orth>
                  </form>, (Msb, TA,) inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">كُفُرٌ</foreign>, (S, Msb, K,) which is the most common form in this case, (El-Basáïr,) and <foreign lang="ar">كَفْرٌ</foreign> (K) and <foreign lang="ar">كُفْرَانٌ</foreign> (Msb, K) and <foreign lang="ar">كُفُورٌ</foreign>, (K,) <hi rend="ital">He disbelieved; he became an unbeliever,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">infidel; contr. of</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">آمَنَ</foreign>, inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">إِيْمَانٌ</foreign>. (S, K.) You say <foreign lang="ar">كَفَرَ بِٱللّٰهِ</foreign> (S, Msb) <hi rend="ital">He disbelieved in God:</hi> (S:) because he who does so conceals, or covers, the truth, and the favours of the liberal Dispenser of favours [who is God]. (MF.) [Also, as shown above, <hi rend="ital">He denied God.</hi>] It is related in a trad. of 'Abd-El-Melik, that he wrote to El- Hajjáj, <foreign lang="ar">مَنْ أَقَرَّ بِالكُفْرِ فَخَلِّ سَبِيلَهُ</foreign>, meaning, <hi rend="ital">Whosoever confesses the unbelief</hi> of him who opposes the Benoo-Marwán, and goes forth against them, <hi rend="ital">let him go his way.</hi> (TA.) See also <foreign lang="ar">كُفْرٌ</foreign>, below.          <sense type="b" n="5">-b5-</sense>  [<hi rend="ital">He blasphemed:</hi> a signification very common in the present day.]          <sense type="b" n="6">-b6-</sense>  Also, <foreign lang="ar">كَفَرَ بِكَذَا</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He declared himself to be clear,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quit, of such a thing.</hi> (Msb.) In this sense it is used in the Kur xiv. 27. (Msb, TA.)          <sense type="b" n="7">-b7-</sense>  And <foreign lang="ar">كَفَرَ</foreign> also signifies <hi rend="ital">He was remiss,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fell short of his duty, with respect to the law, and neglected the gratitude</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thankfulness to God which was incumbent on him.</hi> So in the Kur xxx. 43; as is shown by its being opposed to <foreign lang="ar">عَمِلَ صَالِحًا</foreign>. (TA.)       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">كَفَرَ لَهُ</foreign>, inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">كَفْرٌ</foreign>: see 2.    </entryFree>26:T18b0,<entryFree id="n37097" key="كفّرهُ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <itype>2</itype>        
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">كفّرهُ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form>, inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">تَكْفِيرٌ</foreign>: see 1, first signification, in three places.       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  Hence, <foreign lang="ar">كَفَّرَ الذَّنْبَ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">It</hi> (war in the cause of God [or the like]) <hi rend="ital">covered,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">concealed, the crime</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sin:</hi> (Mgh:) (or <hi rend="ital">expiated it:</hi> or <hi rend="ital">annulled it;</hi> for] <foreign lang="ar">تكفير</foreign> with respect to acts of disobedience is like <foreign lang="ar">إِحْبَاطٌ</foreign> with respect to reward. (S, K.) The saying in the Kur [v. 70.] <foreign lang="ar">لَكَفَّرْنَا عَنْهُمْ سَيِّئَاتِهِمْ</foreign> means, <hi rend="ital">We would cover,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conceal, their sins, so that they should become as though they had not been:</hi> or it may mean, <hi rend="ital">We would do away with their sins;</hi> as is indicated by another saying in the Kur [xi. 116,] “ good actions do away with sins. ” (El-Basáïr.) <foreign lang="ar">كَفَّرَ ٱللّٰهُ عَنْهُ الذَّنْبَ</foreign> signifies <hi rend="ital">God effaced his sin.</hi> (Msb.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  And <foreign lang="ar">كَفَّرَ عَنْ يَمِينِهِ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">He expiated his oath;</hi>] <hi rend="ital">he performed,</hi> (Msb,) or <hi rend="ital">gave,</hi> (K,) <hi rend="ital">what is termed</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">كَفَّارَة</foreign> [i. e. <hi rend="ital">a fast,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">alms, for the expiation of his oath</hi>]: (Msb, K:) <foreign lang="ar">تَكْفِيرٌ</foreign> of an oath is the doing what is incumbent, or obligatory, for the violation, or breaking, thereof: (S:) <foreign lang="ar">كَفَّرَ يَمِينَهُ</foreign> is a vulgar phrase. (Mgh.)       <sense type="A" n="3">-A3-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">كَفَّرَهُ</foreign> as syn. with <foreign lang="ar">أَكْفَرَهُ</foreign>: see 4.       <sense type="A" n="4">-A4-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">كَفَّرَ لَهُ</foreign>, inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">تَكْفِيرٌ</foreign>, (A, Mgh, TA,) <hi rend="ital">He did</hi> 
                  <pb n="2621"/> 
                  <hi rend="ital">obeisance to him, lowering his head,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bowing, and bending himself, and putting his hand upon his breast:</hi> (Mgh:) or <hi rend="ital">put his hand upon his breast and bent himself down to him:</hi> (TA:) or <hi rend="ital">he made a sign of humbling himself to him; did obeisance to him:</hi> (A:) namely, an <foreign lang="ar">عِلْج</foreign> [or unbeliever of the Persians or other foreigners] (A, Mgh) or a <foreign lang="ar">ذِمِّىّ</foreign> [or free non- Muslim subject of a Muslim government, i. e., a Christian, a Jew, or a Sabian] (Mgh) to the king; (A, Mgh;) or a slave to his master, or to his <foreign lang="ar">دِهْقَان</foreign> [or chief]: (TA:) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n37097-1" target="كَفَرَ" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign>, [aor.      
    <form n="infl">       
                     <orth orig="Bu" lang="ar">كَفُرَ</orth>
                  </form>, accord. to the rule of of the K,] (TK,) inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">كَفْرٌ</foreign>, (K,) <hi rend="ital">he</hi> (a Persian, <foreign lang="ar">فَارِسِىٌّ</foreign>, K, and so in the L and other lexicons, but in the TS <foreign lang="ar">فَارِس</foreign>, without <foreign lang="ar">ى</foreign>, which is probably a mistake of copyists, TA) <hi rend="ital">paid honour</hi> to his king, (K, TA,) <hi rend="ital">by making a sing with his head, near to prostration:</hi> (TA:) <foreign lang="ar">تَكْفِيرٌ</foreign> is a man's <hi rend="ital">humbling himself</hi> to another, (S, K, TA,) <hi rend="ital">bending himself, and lowering his head, nearly in the manner termed</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">رُكُوعٌ</foreign>; <hi rend="ital">as one does when he desires to pay honour to his friend;</hi> (TA;) or <hi rend="ital">as the</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">عِلْج</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">does to the</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">دِهْقَان</foreign>: (S:) and the <foreign lang="ar">تكفير</foreign> of the people of the scriptures [or Christians and Jews, and Sabians] one's <hi rend="ital">lowering his head</hi> to his friend, like the <foreign lang="ar">تَسْلِيم</foreign> with the Muslims: or one's <hi rend="ital">putting his hand,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">his two hands, upon his breast:</hi> (TA:) and <foreign lang="ar">تكفير</foreign> in prayer is the <hi rend="ital">bending one's self much in the state of standing, before the action termed</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">رُكُوعٌ</foreign>; the doing of which was disapproved by Mohammad, accord. to a trad. (TA.) It is said in a trad., <foreign lang="ar">إِذَا أَصْبَحَ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">ٱبْنُ آدَمَ فَإِنَّ الأَعْضَآءَ تُكَفِّرُ كُلُّهَا لِلِّسَانِ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">When the son of Adam rises in the morning, verily all the members abase themselves to the tongue,</hi> (Mgh, TA,) <hi rend="ital">and confess obedience to it, and humbly submit to its command.</hi> (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">تَكْفِيرٌ</foreign> also signifies The <hi rend="ital">crowning</hi> a king <hi rend="ital">with a crown,</hi> [because] when he, or it, is seen, obeisance is done to him (<foreign lang="ar">إِذَا رُئِىَ كُفِّرَ لَهُ</foreign>). (K.)          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  See also <foreign lang="ar">تَكْفِيرٌ</foreign> below.    </entryFree>27:T1ab9,<entryFree id="n37111" key="كَافُورٌ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">كَافُورٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form> The <hi rend="ital">spathe,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">envelope of the</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">طَلْع</foreign> [or <hi rend="ital">spadix</hi>], (As, S, K, TA,) or <hi rend="ital">upper covering thereof,</hi> (TA,) <hi rend="ital">of a palm-tree;</hi> (As, S, K, TA;) the <foreign lang="ar">كِمّ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">of a palm-tree:</hi> (Mgh, Msb:) as also   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n37111-1" target="كُفَرَّى" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n37106"/></foreign>, (S, Mgh, Msb,) with damm to the <foreign lang="ar">ك</foreign> and fet-h to the <foreign lang="ar">ف</foreign> and teshdeed to the <foreign lang="ar">ر</foreign>, (Mgh, Msb,) or <foreign lang="ar">كُفُرَّى</foreign>, [so in the copies of the K, and so I have found it written in other works, so that both forms appear to be correct,] and <foreign lang="ar">كَفَرَّى</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">كِفِرَّى</foreign>, (K, * TA,) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n37111-2" target="كَافِرٌ" n="2" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n37110"/></foreign> (AHn, K) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n37111-3" target="كَفَرٌ" n="3" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n37104"/></foreign>: (K:) so called because it conceals what is within it: (Mgh, Msb:) or, accord. to AA and Fr, the <foreign lang="ar">طَلْع</foreign> [by which they probably mean the <hi rend="ital">spathe,</hi> for, as is said in the Mgh, it is applied by some to the <foreign lang="ar">كِمّ</foreign> (or <hi rend="ital">spathe</hi>) <hi rend="ital">before it bursts open</hi>]: (S:) [  
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n37111-4" target="كفرّى" n="4" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign> is sometimes masc., though more properly and commonly fem.:] IAar says, I heard Umm-Rabáh say. <foreign lang="ar">هٰذِهِ كفرّى</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">هٰذَا كفّرى</foreign>: (TA:) the pl. of <foreign lang="ar">كَافُورٌ</foreign> is <foreign lang="ar">كَوَافِيرُ</foreign>; and the pl. of <foreign lang="ar">كَافِرٌ</foreign> is <foreign lang="ar">كَوَافِرُ</foreign>. (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  Also <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  The <foreign lang="ar">زَمَع</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">of the grape-vine;</hi> (K, TA;) i. e., the <hi rend="ital">leaves which cover what is within them of the raceme;</hi> likened to the <foreign lang="ar">كافور</foreign> of the <foreign lang="ar">طلع</foreign>; (TA;) the <foreign lang="ar">كِمّ</foreign> [or <hi rend="ital">calyx</hi>] <hi rend="ital">of the grapes, before the blossom comes forth;</hi> because they cover the unopened raceme; accord. to IF, as also   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n37111-5" target="كُفَرَّى" n="5" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n37106"/></foreign>: (Msb:) pl. <foreign lang="ar">كَوَافِيرُ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">كَوَافِرُ</foreign>, accord. to the K; but it is well known that the former is pl. of <foreign lang="ar">كافور</foreign>, and the latter of <foreign lang="ar">كافر</foreign>. (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  And, accord. to some, <assumedtropical>(assumed tropical:)</assumedtropical>  The <hi rend="ital">envelope</hi> [or <hi rend="ital">calyx</hi>] <hi rend="ital">of any plant.</hi> (TA.)       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  [<hi rend="ital">Camphor;</hi>] <hi rend="ital">a kind of perfume,</hi> (S, K,) <hi rend="ital">well known, from certain trees</hi> [<hi rend="ital">the laurus camphora of Linn.</hi>] <hi rend="ital">in the mountains of the sea of India and China, which afford shadow to many people</hi> or <hi rend="ital">creatures,</hi> (K,) <hi rend="ital">by reason of its greatness and its many spreading branches,</hi> (TA,) <hi rend="ital">which leopards</hi> or <hi rend="ital">panthers frequent, and the wood of which is white and easily broken; the</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">كافور</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">is found within it, and is of various kinds, in colour red, and becoming white only by</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">تَصْعِيد</foreign> [or <hi rend="ital">sublimation</hi>]. (K.)       <sense type="A" n="3">-A3-</sense>  Accord. to the M, <hi rend="ital">A mixture of perfume, composed of the spathe</hi> (<foreign lang="ar">كافور</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">of the spadix of the palm-tree.</hi> (TA.)       <sense type="A" n="4">-A4-</sense>  <hi rend="ital">A certain spring,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fountain, in paradise.</hi> (Fr. K.) So in the Kur [lxxvi. 5,] <foreign lang="ar">إِنَّ ٱلْأَبْرَارَ يَشْرَبُونَ مِنْ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">كَأْسٍ كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا كَافُورًا</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">Verily the pious shall drink a cup</hi> of wine <hi rend="ital">whereof the mixture is Káfoor</hi>]. (Fr.) IDrd says, that it should be imperfectly decl., because it is a fem. [proper] name, determinate, of more than three letters; but it is made perfectly decl. for the conformity of the ends of the verses: Th says, that it is made perfectly decl. because it is used by way of comparison; and that if it were a [proper] name of the spring, or fountain, it would be imperfectly decl.: Th means, says ISd, <hi rend="ital">whereof the mixture is like</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">كافور</foreign> [or <hi rend="ital">camphor</hi>]: and Zj says, that it may mean that the taste of perfume and <foreign lang="ar">كافور</foreign> is in it, or that it is mixed with <foreign lang="ar">كافور</foreign>. (TA.)       <sense type="A" n="5">-A5-</sense>  <hi rend="ital">A certain plant,</hi> (Lth, K,) [which I believe to he the same as the camphorata Monspeliensis, see my “ Thousand and One Nights, ” ch. xxviii. note 6,] <hi rend="ital">of sweet odour,</hi> (ISd, K,) <hi rend="ital">the flower of which is</hi> (Lth, K) <hi rend="ital">white,</hi> (Lth,) <hi rend="ital">like the flower of the</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">أُقْحُوَان</foreign> [or camomile]. (Lth, K.)       <sense type="A" n="6">-A6-</sense>  IDrd says, I do not think the <foreign lang="ar">كافور</foreign> is Arabic, because they sometimes say <foreign lang="ar">قَفُورٌ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">قَافُورٌ</foreign>. (TA.)    </entryFree>28:T5df,<entryFree id="n37098" key="كَافَرَنِى حَقِّى" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <itype>3</itype>        
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">كَافَرَنِى حَقِّى</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He denied,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disacknowledged, to me my right,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">just claim.</hi> (A, Mgh, K.) Hence the saying of 'Ámir, <foreign lang="ar">إِذَا أَقَرَّ عِنْدَ القَاضِى</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">بِشَىْءٍ ثُمَّ كَافَرَ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">When he confesses a thing in the presence of the Kádee, then denies,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disacknowledges:</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">كَافَرَ</foreign> being thus used in the sense of <foreign lang="ar">كَفَرَ</foreign>]. But as to the saying of Mohammad [the lawyer], <foreign lang="ar">رجُلٌ لَهُ عَلَى آخَرَ دَيْنٌ فَكَافَرَهُ بِهِ سِنِينَ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">A man who owed to another a debt, and denied to him, in the case of it, for years</hi>], he seems to have made it imply the meaning of <foreign lang="ar">المُمَاطَلَة</foreign>, and therefore to have made it trans. in the same manner as <foreign lang="ar">المماطلة</foreign> is trans. (Mgh.)    </entryFree>29:Td89,<entryFree id="n37099" key="اكفرهُ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <itype>4</itype>        
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">اكفرهُ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form>, (S, A, Mgh, K,) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n37099-1" target="كفّرهُ" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n37097"/></foreign>, (A, Mgh, Msb,) [the latter of which is the more common in the present day,] <hi rend="ital">He called him a</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">كَافِر</foreign> [i. e. <hi rend="ital">a disbeliever, an unbeliever,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">an infidel</hi>]: (S, Mgh, K:) <hi rend="ital">he attributed,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">imputed to him, charged him with,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">accused him of, disbelief,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">infidelity:</hi> (S, A, Msb:) or <hi rend="ital">he said to him</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">كَفَرْتَ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">Thou hast become an unbeliever,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">infidel,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Thou hast blasphemed:</hi> in this last sense, “ he said to him Thou hast blasphemed, ” <foreign lang="ar">كفّرهُ</foreign>, to which alone it is assigned in the Msb, is very commonly used in the present day]. (Msb.) Hence the saying, <foreign lang="ar">لَا تُكْفِرْ أَحَدًا مِنْ أَهْلِ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">قِبْلَتِكَ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">Do not thou attribute</hi> or <hi rend="ital">impute disbelief</hi> or <hi rend="ital">infidelity to any one of the people of thy kibleh;</hi> (S, TA;) i. e., <hi rend="ital">do not thou call any such a disbeliever, &amp;c.;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">do not thou make him such by thine assertion and thy saying.</hi> (TA.) <foreign lang="ar">لَا تُكَفِّرُوا أَهْلَ قِبْلَتِكُمْ</foreign> is not authorized by the relation, though it be allowable as a dial. form. (Mgh.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  [Also] <foreign lang="ar">أَكْفَرْتُهُ</foreign>, inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">إِكْفَارٌ</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">I made him a disbeliever, an unbeliever,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">an infidel; I compelled him to become a disbeliever,</hi> &amp;c. (Msb.) And <foreign lang="ar">أَكْفَرَ فُلَانٌ صَاحِبَهُ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">Such a one compelled his companion by evil treatment to become disobedient after he had been obedient.</hi> (Mgh.) And <foreign lang="ar">أَكْفَرَ الرَّجُلُ مُطِيعَهُ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">The man compelled him who had obeyed him to disobey him:</hi> (T, TA:) or <hi rend="ital">he made him to be under a necessity to disobey him.</hi> (TA.)       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">اكفر</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He</hi> (a man, TA) <hi rend="ital">kept,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">confined himself, to the</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">كَفْر</foreign>, (K,) i. e. <foreign lang="ar">قَرْيَة</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">town</hi> or <hi rend="ital">village</hi>]; (TA;) as also   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n37099-2" target="اكتفر" n="2" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign>. (IAar, K.)    </entryFree>2a:Te4a,<entryFree id="n37101" key="كَفْرٌ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">كَفْرٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form> The <hi rend="ital">darkness</hi> and <hi rend="ital">blackness of night;</hi> [because it conceals things;] as also, sometimes,   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n37101-1" target="كِفْرٌ" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n37103"/></foreign>. (S, K.) [See also <foreign lang="ar">كَافِرٌ</foreign>.] See a verse cited voce <foreign lang="ar">ذُكَآءُ</foreign>.       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  <hi rend="ital">Earth,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dust;</hi> because it conceals what is beneath it. (Lh.)       <sense type="A" n="3">-A3-</sense>  [Hence also] <hi rend="ital">A grave,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sepulchre:</hi> (S, K:) pl. <foreign lang="ar">كُفُورٌ</foreign>. (S.) Whence the saying, <foreign lang="ar">أَللّهُمَّ ٱغْفِرْ لِأَهْلِ الكُفُورِ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">O God, pardon the people of the graves</hi>]. (S.)       <sense type="A" n="4">-A4-</sense>  [And hence, perhaps,] <hi rend="ital">A town,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">village;</hi> [generally the latter;] syn. <foreign lang="ar">قَرْيَةٌ</foreign>: (S, Mgh, Msb, K:) a Syriac word, and mostly used by the people of Syria [and of Egypt]: or, accord. to El-Harbee, <hi rend="ital">land that is far from men, by which no one passes:</hi> (TA:) pl. <foreign lang="ar">كُفُورٌ</foreign>: (S, Msb:) in the present day, it is applied in Egypt to <hi rend="ital">any small</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">قَرْيَة</foreign> [or <hi rend="ital">village</hi>] <hi rend="ital">by the side of a great</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">قَرْيَة</foreign> [or <hi rend="ital">town</hi>]: they say <foreign lang="ar">القَرْيَةُ الفُلَانِيَّةُ وَكَفْرُهَا</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">Such a town and its village</hi>]: and sometimes one <foreign lang="ar">قَرْيَة</foreign> has a number of <foreign lang="ar">كُفُور</foreign>. (TA.) Hence the saying of Mo'áwiyeh, <foreign lang="ar">أَهْلُ الكُفُورِ هُمْ أَهْلُ القُبُورِ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">The people of the villages are the people of the graves</hi>]; meaning, that they are as the dead; they do not see the great towns and the performance of the congregational prayers of Friday: (S, Mgh:) by <foreign lang="ar">الكفور</foreign> he meant <hi rend="ital">the villages</hi> (<foreign lang="ar">القُرَى</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">remote from the great towns and from the places where the people of science assemble,</hi> so that ignorance prevails among their inhabitants, and they are most quickly affected by innovations in religion and by natural desires which cause to err. (Az, TA.) Hence also the trad. (of Aboo-Hureyreh, TA), <foreign lang="ar">لَيُخْرِجَنَّكُمُ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">ٱلرُّومُ مِنْهَا كَفْرًا كَفْرًا</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">The Greeks will assuredly expel you from them, town by town,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">village by village</hi>]; (S, * TA;) i. e. from the <foreign lang="ar">فُرًى</foreign> of Syria. (S, TA.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">كَفْرٌ عَلَى كَفْرٍ</foreign> also signifies <hi rend="ital">One upon another;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">one part upon another.</hi> (TA.)    </entryFree>2b:Tc04,<entryFree id="n37102" key="كُفْرٌ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">كُفْرٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form>: see 1. [As a simple subst., <hi rend="ital">Ingratitude,</hi> &amp;c.          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  And particularly <hi rend="ital">Denial,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disacknowledgment, of favours</hi> or <hi rend="ital">benefits,</hi> and especially of those <hi rend="ital">conferred by God:</hi> and <hi rend="ital">disbelief, unbelief; infidelity.</hi>] It is of four kinds: <foreign lang="ar">كُفْرُ إِنْكَارٍ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">the denial,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disacknowledgment, of God, with the heart and the tongue, having no knowledge of what is told one of the unity of God</hi> [&amp;c.]: and <foreign lang="ar">كُفْرُ جُحُودٍ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">the acknowledgment with the heart without confessing with the tongue:</hi> [or <hi rend="ital">the disacknowledgment of God with the tongue while the heart acknowledges Him:</hi>] and <foreign lang="ar">كُفْرُ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">المُعَانَدَةِ</foreign> the <hi rend="ital">knowledge of God with the heart, and confession with the tongue, with refusal to accept</hi> [<hi rend="ital">the truth</hi>]: and <foreign lang="ar">كُفْرُ النِّفَاقِ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">the confession with the tongue with disbelief in the heart:</hi> all of these are unpardonable: (L, TA:) the greatest <foreign lang="ar">كُفْر</foreign> is the <hi rend="ital">denial,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disacknowledgment, of the unity</hi> [<hi rend="ital">of God</hi>], or <hi rend="ital">of the prophetic office</hi> [<hi rend="ital">of Mohammad and others</hi>], or <hi rend="ital">of the law of God.</hi> (El-Basáïr.) [Also, <hi rend="ital">Blasphemy.</hi> Its pl., as a simple subst. in all these senses, is said to be <foreign lang="ar">كُفُورٌ</foreign>.]. Akh says, that <foreign lang="ar">كُفُورًا</foreign> [in the accus. case] in the Kur xvii. 101, [to which may be added v. 91 of the same ch., and xxv. 52,] is pl. of <foreign lang="ar">كُفْرٌ</foreign>, like as <foreign lang="ar">بُرُودٌ</foreign> is pl. of <foreign lang="ar">بُرْدٌ</foreign>. (S.)       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  <hi rend="ital">Tar,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pitch,</hi> syn. <foreign lang="ar">قِيرٌ</foreign>; <hi rend="ital">with which ships are smeared;</hi> (K;) of which there are three sorts, <foreign lang="ar">كُفْرٌ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">قِيرٌ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">زِفتٌ</foreign>: <foreign lang="ar">كفر</foreign> is melted, and then ships are smeared with it: [whence, app., its name, from its being a covering:] <foreign lang="ar">زفت</foreign> is used for smearing skins for wine, &amp;c. (ISh.)    </entryFree>2c:T5d4,<entryFree id="n37109" key="كَفَّارَةٌ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">كَفَّارَةٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form> a subst. from <foreign lang="ar">تَكْفِيرُ اليَمِينِ</foreign>, (S,) or an intensive epithet in which the quality of a subst. predominates; signifying [<hi rend="ital">An expiation for a sin</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crime</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a violated oath;</hi>] <hi rend="ital">an action,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a quality, which has the effect of effacing a wrong action</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sin</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crime;</hi> (TA;) <hi rend="ital">that which covers,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conceals, sins</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crimes; such as the</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">كفّارة</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">of oaths</hi> [<hi rend="ital">violated</hi>], <hi rend="ital">and that of</hi> [<hi rend="ital">the kind of divorce termed</hi>] <foreign lang="ar">ظِهَار</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">and of unintentional homicide;</hi> (T, TA;) <hi rend="ital">an expiation</hi> (<foreign lang="ar">مَا كُفِّرَ بِهِ</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">such as an alms-giving,</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a fasting,</hi> and <hi rend="ital">the like:</hi> (K:) pl. <foreign lang="ar">كَفَّارَاتٌ</foreign>. (T, TA.)    </entryFree>2d:T2181,<entryFree id="n37110" key="كَافِرٌ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">كَافِرٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form> 
                  <hi rend="ital">A sower:</hi> (S, K:) or <hi rend="ital">a tiller of the ground:</hi> (Msb:) because he covers over the seed with earth: (S, Msb: *) pl. <foreign lang="ar">كُفَّارٌ</foreign>. (S, TA.) The pl. is said by some to be thus used in the Kur lvii. 19. (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  <hi rend="ital">Dark clouds,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a dark cloud;</hi> (K;) because it conceals what is beneath it. (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  <hi rend="ital">Night:</hi> (K:) or <hi rend="ital">intensely black night;</hi> because it conceals everything by its darkness. (S.)          <sense type="b" n="4">-b4-</sense>  The <hi rend="ital">darkness;</hi> (K;) because it covers what is beneath it; (TA;) as also   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n37110-1" target="كَفْرَةٌ" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n37105"/></foreign>, accord. to the copies of the K; but in the L, <foreign lang="ar">كَفْرٌ</foreign>, q. v. (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="5">-b5-</sense>  The <hi rend="ital">sea;</hi> (S, A, K;) for the same reason. (TA.) Thaalabeh Ibn- So'eyr El-Mazinee says, (S, TA,) describing a male and a female ostrich and their returning to their eggs at sunset, (TA,) <quote>
                     <L>
                        <foreign lang="ar">فَتَذَكَّرَا ثَقَلًا رَثِيدًا بَعْدَمَا</foreign>
                     </L> 
                     <L>
                        <foreign lang="ar">أَلْقَتْ ذُكَآءُ يَمِينَهَا فِى كَافِرِ</foreign>
                     </L> 
                  </quote> [<hi rend="ital">And they remembered goods placed side by side, after the sun had cast its right side into a sea</hi>]; i. e., the sun had begun to set: or the poet may mean [by <foreign lang="ar">كافر</foreign>] night: (S, TA:) but Sgh says, that the right reading is <foreign lang="ar">تَذَكَّرَتْ</foreign>; the pronoun referring to the female ostrich. (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="6">-b6-</sense>  Also, <hi rend="ital">A great river:</hi> (S, K:) used in this sense by El-Mutalemmis: (S:) and <hi rend="ital">a great valley.</hi> (K.)          <sense type="b" n="7">-b7-</sense>  [A man] <hi rend="ital">staying,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">abiding,</hi> [in a place,] <hi rend="ital">and hiding himself.</hi> (TA.) [See an ex. voce <foreign lang="ar">عَرْشٌ</foreign>.]          <sense type="b" n="8">-b8-</sense>  [A man] <hi rend="ital">wearing arms; covered with arms:</hi> (Az, K:) as also   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n37110-2" target="مُكَفِّرٌ" n="2" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n37115"/></foreign> (A, K) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n37110-3" target="مُتَكَفِّرٌ" n="3" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n37117"/></foreign> (S, A) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n37110-4" target="مُكَفَّرٌ" n="4" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign>: (A:) or this last signifies <hi rend="ital">bound fast in iron;</hi> (K, TA;) as though covered and concealed by it: (TA:) pl. of the first, <foreign lang="ar">كُفَّارٌ</foreign>. (K.) Hence the following, (K,) said by Mohammad during the pilgrimage of valediction, (TA,) <foreign lang="ar">لَا تَرْجِعُوا بِعْدِى كُفَّارًا يَضْرِبُ بَعْضُكُمْ رِقَابَ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">بَعْضٍ</foreign> (K) [<hi rend="ital">Do not ye become again, after me,</hi> i. e., after my death,] <hi rend="ital">wearers of arms,</hi> preparing yourselves for fight, [<hi rend="ital">one party of you smiting the necks of others;</hi>] as though he meant thereby to forbid war: (AM, TA:) or [<hi rend="ital">do not ye become unbelievers, after me,</hi> &amp;c.; i. e.,] do not ye call people unbelievers, and so become unbelievers [yourselves]. (AM, K, TA.)          <sense type="b" n="9">-b9-</sense>  <hi rend="ital">A coat of mail;</hi> (Sgh, K;) because it conceals what is beneath it. (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="10">-b10-</sense>  One <hi rend="ital">who has covered his coat of mail with a garment worn over it.</hi> (S.)          <sense type="b" n="11">-b11-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">كَافِرُ الدُّرُوعِ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">A garment that is worn over the coat of mail.</hi> (A.)       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  One <hi rend="ital">who denies,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disacknowledges, the favours</hi> or <hi rend="ital">benefits of God:</hi> (K:) [<hi rend="ital">ungrateful; unthankful;</hi> especially <hi rend="ital">to God:</hi>] one <hi rend="ital">who denies,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disacknowledges, the unity</hi> [<hi rend="ital">of God</hi>], <hi rend="ital">and the prophetic office</hi> [<hi rend="ital">of Mohammad and others</hi>], <hi rend="ital">and the law of God,</hi> altogether, accord. to the common conventional acceptation: <hi rend="ital">a disbeliever; an unbeliever; an infidel; a miscreant; contr. of</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">مُؤْمِنٌ</foreign>: (El- Basáïr:) because he conceals the favours of God: (S:) or because his heart is covered; as though it were of the measure <foreign lang="ar">فَاعِلٌ</foreign> in the sense of the measure <foreign lang="ar">مَفْعُولٌ</foreign>: (IDrd, TA:) or because <foreign lang="ar">كُفْر</foreign> covers his heart altogether: (Lth, TA:) i. e. having a covering to his heart: or because, when God invites him to acknowledge his unity, He invites him to accept his favours; and when he refuses to do so, he covers the favour of God, excluding it from him: (Az, TA:) fem. with <foreign lang="ar">ة</foreign>: (S, Msb, K:) pl. masc. <foreign lang="ar">كَفَرَةٌ</foreign>, (S, Msb, K,) the most common pl. of <foreign lang="ar">كافر</foreign> in the first of the senses explained above, (El-Basáïr,) and <foreign lang="ar">كُفَّارٌ</foreign>, (S, Msb, K,) the most common pl. of the same in the last of those senses, as contr. of <foreign lang="ar">مؤمن</foreign>, (El-Basáïr,) and <foreign lang="ar">كِفَارٌ</foreign> (S, K) and <foreign lang="ar">كَافِرُونَ</foreign>: (Msb:) and pl. fem. <foreign lang="ar">كَوَافِرُ</foreign> (S, Msb, K) and <foreign lang="ar">كَافِرَاتٌ</foreign>: (Msb:) and   
      <foreign lang="ar">رَجُلٌ <ref cref="n37110-5" target="كَفَّارٌ" n="5" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n37108"/></foreign>, and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n37110-6" target="كَفُورٌ" n="6" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n37107"/></foreign> signify the same as <foreign lang="ar">كَافِرٌ</foreign>: (K:) or <foreign lang="ar">كَفُورٌ</foreign> is an intensive epithet, meaning <hi rend="ital">very ungrateful,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unthankful,</hi> [&amp;c., especially <hi rend="ital">to God</hi>]: so in the Kur xxii. 65, and xliii. 14: and <foreign lang="ar">كَفَّارٌ</foreign> has a more intensive signification than <foreign lang="ar">كَفُورٌ</foreign>, [meaning <hi rend="ital">habitually ungrateful,</hi> &amp;c.:] os in the Kur <foreign lang="ar">ا</foreign> 23: but sometimes it is used in the sense of <foreign lang="ar">كَفُورٌ</foreign>; as in the Kur xiv. 37: (ElBasáïr:)   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n37110-7" target="كَفُورٌ" n="7" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n37107"/></foreign> is fem. as well as masc.; (TA;) and its pl. is <foreign lang="ar">كُفُرٌ</foreign>, (K, * TA,) also both masc. and fem.; and it has no unbroken pl. (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  Also, simply, <hi rend="ital">Denying,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disacknowledging; a denier,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disacknowledger:</hi> followed by<foreign lang="ar">بِ</foreign> before the thing denied: pl. <foreign lang="ar">كَافِرُونَ</foreign>: (S, TA;) so in the Kur ii. 38, (TA,) and xxviii. 48. (S, TA.)          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  [Also, <hi rend="ital">Blaspheming; a blasphemer.</hi>]       <sense type="A" n="3">-A3-</sense>  See also <foreign lang="ar">كَافُورٌ</foreign>.
